senselogic.sitevision.api.resource

Interface ResourceLocatorUtil


  • @Requireable(value="ResourceLocatorUtil")
public interface ResourceLocatorUtil
    Utility interface for locating resources.

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface can be obtained via Utils.getResourceLocatorUtil(). See Utils for how to obtain an instance of the Utils interface.

    Author:
    Magnus LÃ¶vgren

    • Method Detail

      • getRootNode

        Node getRootNode()
        Gets the JCR Root Node for current Site.

        This is a non-throwing convenience for the Session.getRootNode() method.

        Returns:
        the JCR Root Node, or null if indeterminable
        Since:
        Sitevision 2023.11.1

      • getSite

        Node getSite()
        Gets current site (i.e. the site node of the page for the currently executing portlet).

        Note! If you are interested in the actual start page, you should use the getSitePage() method.

        Returns:
        current site Node, or null if indeterminable (e.g. current portlet and/or current page is not bound to any site)
        See Also:
        getSitePage()

      • getSitePage

        Node getSitePage()
        Gets current site page (i.e. the site's start page node of the page for the currently executing portlet).

        Note! If you are interested in the actual site, you should use the getSite() method.

        Returns:
        current site page Node, or null if indeterminable (e.g. current portlet and/or current page is not bound to any site)
        See Also:
        getSite()

      • getPersonalFileRepository

        Node getPersonalFileRepository(Node aNode)
        Gets the personal file repository for a specified node.

        A personal file repository contains files that belongs to a sv:collaborationGroup (i.e. "group files") or a sv:userIdentity (e.g. files attached when posting timeline entries).

        Convenience note! This method will extract and use the corresponding sv:collaborationGroup if the aNode argument is a sv:collaborationGroupPage. It will also try to extract and use the corresponding sv:userIdentity if the aNode argument is a sv:user.

        Parameters:
        aNode - a node that has a personal file repository (typically a sv:collaborationGroup or sv:userIdentity)
        Returns:
        the personal file repository for aNode, or null if indeterminable.
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6.4

      • getPersonalImageRepository

        Node getPersonalImageRepository(Node aNode)
        Gets the personal image repository for a specified node.

        A personal image repository contains images that belongs to a sv:collaborationGroup or a sv:userIdentity (e.g. profile image).

        Convenience note! This method will extract and use the corresponding sv:collaborationGroup if the aNode argument is a sv:collaborationGroupPage. It will also try to extract and use the corresponding sv:userIdentity if the aNode argument is a sv:user.

        Parameters:
        aNode - a node that has a personal image repository (typically a sv:collaborationGroup or sv:userIdentity)
        Returns:
        the personal image repository for aNode, or null if indeterminable.
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6.4

      • getIconRepository

        Node getIconRepository()
        Gets the icon repository for the site of current node.

        The icon repository contains all site-specific file icon nodes.

        Returns:
        the icon repository for the site of current node, or null if indeterminable

      • getIndexRepository

        Node getIndexRepository()
        Gets the index repository for the site of current node.

        Tip! The IndexUtil utility can be used for easy index lookup.

        Returns:
        the index repository for the site of current node, or null if indeterminable
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6

      • getDefaultImageRepository

        Node getDefaultImageRepository()
        Gets the default image repository for the site of current node.

        The default image repository contains system/server-specific images/icons.

        Returns:
        the default image repository for the site of current node, or null if indeterminable

      • getDirectoryRepository

        Node getDirectoryRepository()
        Gets the LDAP directories repository for the site of current node
        Returns:
        the LDAP directories repository, or null if indeterminable

      • getNodeByIdentifier

        Node getNodeByIdentifier(String anIdentifier)
        Gets a Node given its identifier.

        Note! This is mere a convenience alias for Session.getNodeByIdentifier(String) but unlike the original, this method returns null instead of throwing an exception if given identifier can't be matched to an existing node.

        Parameters:
        anIdentifier - a Node identifier
        Returns:
        the corresponding Node or null
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6.5

      • getNodeByPath

        Node getNodeByPath(String anAbsolutePath)
        Gets a Node given its absolute path.

        Note! This is mere a convenience alias for Session.getNode(String) but unlike the original, this method returns null instead of throwing an exception if given absolute path can't be matched to an existing node.

        Parameters:
        anAbsolutePath - an absolute path
        Returns:
        the corresponding Node or null
        Since:
        Sitevision 3.6.5

      • getNodeByUrl

        Node getNodeByUrl(String anUrl)
        Gets a Node given its URL
        Parameters:
        anUrl - an url pointing to the resource (e.g. page, portlet, file, image)
        Returns:
        the corresponding Node or null
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.1

      • getNodeId

        @Deprecated
String getNodeId(Object aInternalObject)
        Deprecated. This is a legacy method for really old Velocity templates that uses internal Sitevision objects.

        Resolves a potential JCR Node identifier for an internal Sitevision object.

        This is a deprecated legacy method for conversions between internal Sitevision objects and API objects (javax.jcr.Node). This behaviour is typically only applicable in really old Velocity templates that was released prior to the API (i.e. templates released before 2008). This method is not intended for javax.jcr.Node objects! To get the "id" of a javax.jcr.Node - use the Node.getIdentifier() method.

        Parameters:
        aInternalObject - a internal Sitevision object
        Returns:
        a potential JCR Node identifier, or null if aInternalObject is null. The identifier for the sv:sitePage Node is returned if aInternalObject corresponds to the "site". Note that there are no guarantee that returned value actually is a valid JCR Node identifier
        Since:
        Sitevision 2.6.1_01

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).

Copyright© 2008-2025 Sitevision AB, all rights reserved.
